qas.question: What political philosophy did Nasser adopt?
What global period was Positive Neutralism meant to deal with?
How did the Egyptian people react to Nasser after the conference?
How did the Egyptian press react to Nasser's accomplishments?

context: Following Bandung, Nasser officially adopted the "<a0_0>positive neutralism<a0_0/>" of Yugoslavian president Josip Broz Tito and Indian Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru as a principal theme of Egyptian foreign policy regarding the <a1_0>Cold War<a1_0/>. Nasser was <a2_0>welcomed by large crowds<a2_0/> of people lining the streets of Cairo on his return to Egypt on 2 May and was widely <a3_0>heralded<a3_0/> in the press for his achievements and leadership in the conference. Consequently, Nasser's prestige was greatly boosted as was his self-confidence and image.
